intro: Rumea inermis, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. Rumea inermis is relatively small, reaching heights of only a few centimeters, and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky outcrops.
